text:
{"fixed_xml":"<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ITEM>2. Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung ist zu erfragen, wo folgende Bücher irraisonablem Preiß zu haben seyen :
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Janii & Tremellii Biblia cum Annotationibus</TITLE>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Acta Eruditorum Lipsiensia</TITLE> de An.
    <YEAR>1738</YEAR> & <YEAR>1739</YEAR>.
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Mohemii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>institutiones histor. Christ.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>maiores 1. Seculi</VOLUME>, samtl. in <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>.
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Titus Livius</TITLE> ex Editione <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Tristiam & Epistolae ex Ponto</TITLE> mit <AUTHOR>Sinceri</AUTHOR> Anmerckungen
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Herodianus</AUTHOR> Graece & Latine cum notis <AUTHOR>Bocceri</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Elianus</AUTHOR> Graece & Latine cum notis <AUTHOR>Schefferi</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Schrevelii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Lexicon Graeco Latinum & Lat. Graec.</TITLE>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Nisselii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE>
  </BIBL>; und
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE>, samtl. in <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>.
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":7,"explanation":"1) Escaped all bare ampersands in text nodes to '&' (e.g., 'Janii & Tremellii', '1738 & 1739', 'Graece & Latine', etc.) to make the XML well-formed. 2) Added an XML declaration. 3) Normalized/decoded obvious OCR/encoding artifacts in running text and formats: 'B√ücher'→'Bücher', 'Preiß' kept as historical spelling, '4t√≤'→'4to', '8v√≤'→'8vo'. 4) Closed the 'Mohemii' bibliographic item by wrapping its trailing text in the same <BIBL> element (it previously leaked outside and caused structural inconsistency). 5) Kept punctuation (semicolons/commas) outside the <BIBL> blocks for consistent structure. 6) Left content order intact while adding line breaks/indentation for readability (no semantic change). 7) Did not invent extra tags beyond <BIBL>/<AUTHOR>/<TITLE>/<YEAR>/<VOLUME>/<FORMAT>; only adjusted boundaries where the markup was clearly intended."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ITEM>2. Bey Herrn Euler dem Buchbinder am Rheinsprung ist zu erfragen, wo folgende Bücher irraisonablem Preiß zu haben seyen :
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Janii & Tremellii Biblia cum Annotationibus</TITLE>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Acta Eruditorum Lipsiensia</TITLE> de An.
    <YEAR>1738</YEAR> & <YEAR>1739</YEAR>.
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Mohemii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>institutiones histor. Christ.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>maiores 1. Seculi</VOLUME>, samtl. in <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>.
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Titus Livius</TITLE> ex Editione <AUTHOR>Joannis Clerici</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Tristiam & Epistolae ex Ponto</TITLE> mit <AUTHOR>Sinceri</AUTHOR> Anmerckungen
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Herodianus</AUTHOR> Graece & Latine cum notis <AUTHOR>Bocceri</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Elianus</AUTHOR> Graece & Latine cum notis <AUTHOR>Schefferi</AUTHOR>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Schrevelii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Lexicon Graeco Latinum & Lat. Graec.</TITLE>
  </BIBL>;
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Nisselii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Biblia Hebraea</TITLE>
  </BIBL>; und
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Buxtorfii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Lexicon</TITLE>, samtl. in <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT>.
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation: 1) Escaped all bare ampersands in text nodes to '&' (e.g., 'Janii & Tremellii', '1738 & 1739', 'Graece & Latine', etc.) to make the XML well-formed. 2) Added an XML declaration. 3) Normalized/decoded obvious OCR/encoding artifacts in running text and formats: 'B√ücher'→'Bücher', 'Preiß' kept as historical spelling, '4t√≤'→'4to', '8v√≤'→'8vo'. 4) Closed the 'Mohemii' bibliographic item by wrapping its trailing text in the same <BIBL> element (it previously leaked outside and caused structural inconsistency). 5) Kept punctuation (semicolons/commas) outside the <BIBL> blocks for consistent structure. 6) Left content order intact while adding line breaks/indentation for readability (no semantic change). 7) Did not invent extra tags beyond <BIBL>/<AUTHOR>/<TITLE>/<YEAR>/<VOLUME>/<FORMAT>; only adjusted boundaries where the markup was clearly intended.
